revised_title: Experiments and Observations on Sound and Light by Thomas Young
tldr: In this letter to Edward Whitaker Gray, Thomas Young presents his findings on the measurement of air discharge, the direction and velocity of air streams, and the relationship between sound and light. He also discusses the velocity of sound, sonorous cavities, and the decay of sound. Young's experiments and observations contribute to the understanding of acoustics, fluid dynamics, and the wave theory of light and sound.
